strings.string: This species of {STRING_0} is too shy to come out of the {STRING_245004}.\n \n[You need to download a Mod that contains Gen 5 follower sprites]
You have been disconnected from the game server\nfor being AFK.

A software update is available for your Pokedex! Downloading...
Your Pokedex was updated with an Encounter Tracker!
 
[To open the Tracker back open once closed...
-Click the Pokedex button on the bottom (PC version)
-Click Encounter Tracker button in menu (Mobile version)]
The Egg Incubator has not been unlocked yet.\n \n[First meet the Daycare Man of any region to receive your first 5]

Great! First, let me give you these incubators to hatch the eggs.
 
[To receive more you can, defeat the Elite 4,
defeat Ho-Oh in a Rematch, and defeat Red in Mt. Silver]
A small crevice is seen on the wall.\nA {STRING_110290} may allow you to break it open.
It's soft fertile soil.\nWould you like to plant seeds?
This plant is dead.\nIt looks like it did not get enough water.\nDo you want to clean up the plot?
This plant is dead.\nIt looks like it was overwatered.\nDo you want to clean up the plot?
This plant is dead.\nIt looks like it was fully grown, but never picked.\nDo you want to clean up the plot?
There are {01} {00}!\nWould you like to pick the {00}?

Ho-Ho! Your eyes do not deceive you. Those are my incredibly
rare Shiny {00} and {01}! My name is Baron Moray,
world-renowned connoisseur of Shiny {STRING_0}! I'm here to
offer you a fantastic deal, you see! Trade your Shiny {STRING_0}
to me, and I'll give you Prismatic Pearls in exchange.

Hm...

Sorry!
I can't take {STRING_0} which were
given as a Gift!
Hmm...\nIt doesn't seem like you have any\nShiny {STRING_0} with you!

Hm... ... ...
Yep, that's a Shiny {01}!
I'll give you {00} Prismatic Pearl(s)for your Shiny {01}.
Is that agreeable?
Hm... That's a pretty rare {01}!\nHow about {00} Prismatic Pearl(s)?
Wow! That's a really rare {01}! I must have it!\nHow about {00} Prismatic Pearl(s) for your Shiny {01}?
Thanks for the trade! Want to exchange more?
Are you sure you want to transfer the Hidden Ability\nattribute from {00} to {01}?\n{02} Prismatic Pearls will be consumed.
If you find any, bring them to me.\nI can revive them!
You have a Fossil with you, don't you?\nDo you want me to bring it back to life?
Come back if you change your mind.
Oh! Oh! Look!\n{00} was revived from the {01}!
Please take good care of it.
Sorry, but you don't have any room.\nCome back when you're able to take this {STRING_0}.
Do you want me to revive another fossil?
Where would you like to start?
Hello! I am the Special Move Tutor, I can teach your {STRING_0}\nmoves they cannot normally learn in exchange for Battle Points.
Would you like me to teach a special move to your {STRING_0}?
Thank you for using the Battle Point Exchange Service.

I'm the {STRING_10}. I breed {STRING_0} to help them
unlock their true potential. Your {STRING_0} seem healthy!
How about a trade? I'll keep two of your {STRING_0},
and in return I will give you an egg.
You won't get these {STRING_0} back.\nAre you sure?
Which {STRING_0} would you like to trade?
Ah, it's you! You're just in time. Your {STRING_0} had an Egg!\nAs promised, it belongs to you.
My brothers call me a Move Maniac. I can teach every\nmove a {STRING_0} could have learned while leveling up,\nand I can make it forget any of them.
Do you want to relearn or forget a move?
I see. Come back if you change your mind.
You do not have enough money.
It will cost {00}x {01} to teach {02}.\nIs this OK?
Which {STRING_0} should have its move removed?
This {STRING_0} can't forget its only move!
It'll cost ${00} for {02} to forget {01}.\nAre you sure you want to forget it?
Do you want to relearn or forget another move?
I'm the Move Master of {00}! My brothers and I have\nscoured the lands to learn every technique we can!
Do you want me to tutor a {STRING_0} of yours?
It will cost {00}x {01} and\n{02}x {03} to teach {04}.\nIs this OK?
Sorry, I don't have anything I can teach that {STRING_0}!
Come back if you change your mind.
Did you know you can modify a Bicycle's appearance?\nWith our Bicycle skins you can stand out!
Sorry, this instance is still on cooldown. You can enter again in\n{00}.
Would you kindly bring some {STRING_0} from swarms?\n For 8 of them, I'll offer you a {STRING_101730}.
Ah.. I love the spring.\nHave you caught more of those unruly\n{STRING_0} for me?
Ohoho~ Thank you!\nIt'll be {00} more until the next reward.
Hi, I'm your personal stylist! Would you like a makeover?
Hi, I'm your personal stylist! Wait... Is that a {00}?\nIf you want, we can use that to change anything about yourself!\nWhat can I do for you today?
It'll cost ${00} for your makeover.\nIs that okay?
I'm sorry, but you don't have enough money.
Are you sure you want to use your {00}?

An item to be held by a {STRING_0}.
It slightly reduces the foe's Accuracy by 10%.

If held by a {STRING_150202} while breeding, it may help them produce a {STRING_150360} egg.

An item to be held by a {STRING_0}.
It slightly reduces the chance of encountering wild {STRING_0} by a third.

If held by a {STRING_150358} while breeding, it may help them produce a {STRING_150433} egg.

A Pokémon held item that boosts the
power of HP-stealing moves to let the
holder recover more HP.

it restores 30% more HP than it otherwise would. Additionally, a Pokémon holding a Big Root regains 30% more HP from Leech Seed, Ingrain and Aqua Ring.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is\na thick pair of glasses that slightly\nboosts the power of special moves by 10%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a magnifying lens that slightly\nboosts the accuracy of moves by 10%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a lens that boosts the holder's\ncritical-hit ratio by 1 stage.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIf the holder moves after its target,\nits accuracy will be boosted by %20.
A brightly gleaming orb to be held by\nDialga. It boosts the power of Dragon-\nand Steel-type moves by 20%.
A beautifully glowing orb to be held by\nPalkia. It boosts the power of Dragon-\nand Water-type moves by 20%.
A glowing orb to be held by Giratina.\nIt boosts the power of Dragon- and\nGhost-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by Cubone or\nMarowak. It is a hard bone of some\nsort that boosts the Attack stat by double.
An item to be held by Clamperl.\nA fang that gleams a sharp silver, it\nraises the Sp. Atk stat by double.

An item to be held by Farfetch'd. It is
a very long and stiff stalk of leek
that boosts the critical-hit ratio by
2 stages.
An item to be held by Chansey. It is a\npair of gloves that boosts Chansey's\ncritical-hit ratio by 2 stages.
An item to be held by a {STRING_0}. When the holder successfully uses a sound-based move, Sp. Attack is raised by 1 stage.\n\nConsumed upon use.
An item to be held by a {STRING_0}. If the holder is hit by an Ice-type move, their Attack will increase by 1 stage.\n\nConsumed upon use.
A consumable bulb. If the holder is hit\nby a Water-type move, its Sp. Atk\nwill rise by 1 stage.
A consumable battery. If the\nholder is hit by an Electric-type\nmove, its Attack will rise by 1 stage.
A mysterious evolutionary lump. When\nheld, it raises the Defense and Sp. Def by 50% of a Pokémon that can still evolve.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holder may endure a potential KO\nattack, leaving it with just 1HP 12% of the time.
An item to be held by a POKéMON.\nIt casts a tricky glare that lowers\nthe opponent's accuracy by 10%. The effect does not apply to one-hit KO moves
An item to be held by Ditto.\nExtremely fine yet hard, this odd\npowder boosts the Defense stat by double. It does not work when Ditto is transformed.
An item to be held by Clamperl.\nA scale that shines a faint pink, it\nraises the Sp. Def stat by 50%.

When held by a Pokémon, the Pokémon
will float into the air. When the holder
is attacked, this item will burst.

This item is consumed upon use.

A card with a mysterious power. When
the holder is struck by a foe, the
attacker is removed from battle.

This item is consumed upon use.

If the holder is hit by an attack, it will
switch with another Pokémon in
your party.

This item is consumed upon use.
An item to be held by a {STRING_0}. If the holder is hit by a Water-type move, their Sp. Defense will increase by 1 stage.\n\nConsumed upon use.
A held item which restores any negative stat stage in battle.\n\nThis item is consumed upon use.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA light, sharp claw that lets the\nbearer move first occasionally by 20% regardless of Trick Room and Stall.
An item to be held by Ditto.\nExtremely fine yet hard, this odd\npowder boosts the Speed stat by double. It does not work when Ditto is transformed.

An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is tremendously heavy and makes
the holder move slower than usual.

Forces the holder to move last in its priority bracket, regardless of its Speed
A Pokémon held item that cuts Speed in half.\nIt makes Flying-type and levitating\nholders susceptible to Ground moves.
An item to be held by a {STRING_0}. When {STRING_110433} takes effect, the holder's Speed is lowered by 1 stage.\n\nThis item is consumed upon use.
A very light stone. It reduces the\nweight of a Pokémon by half when held.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt helps keep wild Pokémon away by a third if the holder is the first one in the party.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Fighting-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Flying-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Poison-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Ground-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Rock-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Bug-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Ghost-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Steel-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Fire-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Water-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Grass-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Electric-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Psychic-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Ice-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Dragon-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Dark-type moves by 20%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nWhen the holder inflicts damage,\nthe target may flinch by 10%. Effect does not apply to moves that already grant flinch or multi hit moves.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt may make foes and allies flinch\nwhen the holder inflicts damage by 10%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a sharply hooked claw that ups\nthe holder's critical-hit ratio by 1 stage.
A hypnotizing sphere. Gazing into it makes you feel drowsy..\n\n Use to enter New moon Island and fight Darkrai.
A reward for defeating a Raid Boss. It seems attracted to other Strange Chunks.\n\n Collect all to create a {STRING_101764} and obtain Darkrai at New moon Island.

A scary looking snack that can feed 1 to a Miniboss or 5 to the Pumpking

 Locations of the Pumpking:
 K: Lavender Town
 J: Ecruteak City
 H: Fallarbor Town
 S: Solaceon Town
 U: Driftveil City

A fancy looking snack that can be feed to the Pumpking

 Locations of the Pumpking:
 K: Lavender Town
 J: Ecruteak City
 H: Fallarbor Town
 S: Solaceon Town
 U: Driftveil City
A culmination of hopes and dreams.\n\n Use to enter Birth Island and fight Jirachi.
Although only marked with a footprint, you can feel it represents that which a {STRING_0} desires most.\n\n Collect all to create a {STRING_101778} and obtain Jirachi at Birth Island.

A big, fancy looking present.

Santa's looking for these.
Can be exchanged in bundles of 5.

 Locations of Santa:
 K: Vermilion City
 J: Olivine City
 H: Slateport City
 S: Hearthome City
 U: Castelia City

Santa's looking for these.
Can be exchanged in bundles of 5.

A bundle of dying flowers.
Although at the end of their lives, they yearn for one final Spring.

 Use this and head to {STRING_143063} to catch Shaymin!

A dying flower found when defeating a challenging foe.
Maybe something can revive it?

 Collect 12 to create a {STRING_101784} and catch Shaymin at {STRING_143063}.
A fossil of an ancient {STRING_150138} that\nlived in the sea. It appears to be\npart of a seashell.
A fossil of an ancient {STRING_150140} that\nlived in the sea. It appears to be\npart of a shell.
A piece of amber that contains the\ngenetic material of an ancient {STRING_150142}.\nIt is clear with a reddish tint.
A fossil of an ancient {STRING_150345} that\nlived in the sea. It appears to be\npart of a plant root.
A fossil of an ancient {STRING_150347} that\nlived in the sea. It appears to be\npart of a claw.
A fossil from a prehistoric {STRING_150410}\nthat lived on the land. It appears to\nbe part of a collar.
A fossil from a prehistoric {STRING_150408}\nthat lived on the land. It appears to\nbe part of a head.
A fossil of an ancient {STRING_150564} that\nlived in the sea in ancient times.\nIt appears to be part of its back.
A fossil of an ancient {STRING_150566} that\nflew in the sky in ancient times.\nIt appears to be part of its wing.

A red Apricorn.
Used to craft a {STRING_245493}
 at {STRING_144129} with Kurt for $1,250.
It assails your nostrils.

A blue Apricorn.
Used to craft a {STRING_245494}
 at {STRING_144129} with Kurt for $1,000.
It smells a bit like grass.

A yellow Apricorn.
Used to craft a {STRING_245498}
 at {STRING_144129} with Kurt for $500.
It has an invigorating scent.

A green Apricorn.
Used to craft a {STRING_245497}
 at {STRING_144129} with Kurt for $500.
It has a mysterious, aromatic scent.

A pink Apricorn.
Used to craft a {STRING_245496}
 at {STRING_144129} with Kurt for $1,250.
It has a nice, sweet scent.

A white Apricorn.
Used to craft a {STRING_245492}
 at {STRING_144129} with Kurt for $500.
It doesn't smell like anything.

A black Apricorn
Used to craft a {STRING_245495}
 at {STRING_144129} with Kurt for $500.
It has an indescribable scent.

A {STRING_245004} which becomes more effective the longer a wild {STRING_0} is asleep.
{STRING_245576} increases in effectiveness
depending on how long the target has been asleep.

Awake: 1.0x
Sleep 1st Turn: 1.5x
Sleep 2nd Turn: 2.5x
Sleep 3rd Turn: 4.0x
A {STRING_245004} which is excellent at capturing {STRING_0} with base Speed of 100 or more.
A {STRING_245004} which makes a {STRING_0} very happy upon capture, giving them 78% happiness. These offer a catch rate of 2.5x on {STRING_0} which have a happiness evolution in their evolution line.

A Poké Ball for catching very heavy
Pokémon.

1.0x for species with < [100kg | 220.46lbs]
2.0x for species with < [200kg | 440.92lbs]
3.0x for species with < [300kg | 661.38lbs]
4.0x for species with >= [300kg | 661.38lbs]
A Poké Ball for catching any Pokémon in an evolution line that includes a Moon Stone evolution.

A somewhat different {STRING_240004} that
works especially well on lower level
{STRING_0} in the wild.

 Starting from levels 1-16 {STRING_0} catch rate is 4.0x, each lvl up a {STRING_0} goes it losses 0.2x catch rate.

 lvl 1-16: 4.0x lvl 17: 3.8x
 lvl 18: 3.6x lvl 19: 3.4x
 lvl 20: 3.2x lvl 21: 3.0x
 lvl 22: 2.8x lvl 23: 2.6x
 lvl 24: 2.4x lvl 25: 2.2x
 lvl 26: 2.0x lvl 27: 1.8x
 lvl 28: 1.6x lvl 29: 1.4x
 lvl 30: 1.2x
A somewhat different {STRING_240004} which works especially well on Water and Bug-type {STRING_0}. It's not affected by moves or abilities which change a {STRING_0}'s typing.

A somewhat different Poké Ball that
provides a better catch rate if it is
used at the start of a wild encounter.
It will always capture a {STRING_0} with a
catch rate of 154 or higher 100%

A {STRING_245004} which grows in strength every consecutive capture of a species of {STRING_0} by 0.1x until a max of 15 is caught in a row. It powers up even when using a different type of {STRING_245004}. Its power is reset to 1.0x if you capture something else, or if you don't capture anything for a few days.

A somewhat different Ball that
becomes progressively better the
more turns there are in a battle.
Each turn that passes the catch rate increases by 0.3x.

Turn 1: 1.0x Turn 2: 1.3x
Turn 3: 1.6x Turn 4: 1.9x
Turn 5: 2.2x Turn 6: 2.5x
Turn 7: 2.8x Turn 8: 3.1x
Turn 9: 3.4x Turn 10: 3.7x
Turn 11: 4.0x
